definition[0]: to depend on someone or something, especially in a difficult situation
example[1]: With luck, you might cover your costs, but don’t count on it.
example[2]: We’re all counting on winning this contract.
example[3]: They were counting on him not coming out of hospital.
example[4]: You can count on Dean to ruin any party.
note[1]: count on somebody/something to do something
example[5]: The presence of Paula was one thing he hadn’t counted on.
example[6]: We didn’t count on so many people being on vacation.
